abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Economic
            Governance and Recovery Grant Project for Cote d'Ivoire
            were as follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory, risk
            to development outcome was high, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: The main lesson is that a
            well designed, non-programmatic series of stand-alone
            operations can form a basis for reasonably predictable
            policy-based support, even in highly uncertain political
            environments such as Côte d’Ivoire. This operation has
            facilitated progress even as it faced major risks. Second,
            the identification of a single counterpart from the
            Government side offered a strong advantage in implementation
            of reforms. This has eased the return to the reform agenda
            after the crisis, many of the counterparts on the government
            side have remained in place. Third, the operations relative
            success in difficult circumstances illustrates the need,
            underlined in the good practice principles referred to
            earlier, for parsimony and selectivity in choosing prior
            actions, outcome indicators, and targets. A more complex
            design, a longer list of actions and targets, or a broader
            set of areas of intervention would likely have resulted in a
            less satisfactory operational impact.
